page.title: 10The Social Club
page.content: {South Kirkby Miners Welfare}was built in 1971 and paid for,by the miners, with a levy of 2p a week.They were also given a grant by Ciswell,a welfare organisation.It is the hub of the village where many wvents take place.The club is administered by both the{N.C.B. and the N.U.M}but no_one involved receives any payment.It is all on a{voluntary basis.}The club has many activities that take place throughout the year;such as darts, pool,dancing lessons for children(both modern,tap and ballet)and social dancing for adults.The{sporting {facilities}are superb and they have both cricket and football teams.Social events for all the community take place,weddings,funerals and engagements.Gala day and Bonfire Night are super occasions.It is truly a social centre.
